cyclone.name: CLAUDETTE
cyclone.current_location: about 310 miles south of Morgan City, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: moving north toward the north-central Gulf Coast, then forecast to arc northeastward across the Southeast states toward the Mid-Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north-central Gulf Coast near the Louisiana coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch/Warning only in effect for Intracoastal City, LA eastward to the western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.warning_coast: Intracoastal City, LA to Okaloosa/Walton County line, FL including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas and Metropolitan New Orleans
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast (LA-MS-AL-western FL Panhandle) and, later, inland portions of the Southeast U.S.
weather_observation.wind: Gusty easterly winds 20–30 mph possible as remnant low passes nearby Monday night
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected in Delaware Bay or the Port of Wilmington
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of moderate to heavy rain (1–2 inches) possible late Monday into Tuesday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Low-end tornado threat cannot be ruled out across the Delmarva if remnant circulation tracks close enough
